name: Vegan Quiche Recipe
description: This easy Vegan Quiche Recipe features an almond flour pastry and cheesy, savory tofu filling with sauteed mushrooms, leeks, sun-dried tomatoes and spinach! Perfect for brunch! Gluten-free option. Oil-free option
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons flour (I use all-purpose. You can also use oat flour to make it gluten-free.)
2 teaspoons  flaxseed meal  (mixed with 2 tablespoons of water)
1/2 teaspoon Indian Sulfur salt or Kala Namak
1 teaspoon oil (or use 2-3 tbsp broth to sauté to make Oilfree )
3/4 cup frozen spinach thawed and squeezed lightly

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Pie crust:   In a bowl or food processor, add the flour, almond flour, salt, herbs, and pulse or mix. Add in the flax egg and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Pie crust:   In a bowl or food processor, add the flour, almond flour, salt, herbs, and pulse or mix. Add in the flax egg and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in 4 tablespoons of non-dairy milk and mix well or process 10-15 seconds
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in 4 tablespoons of non-dairy milk and mix well or process 10-15 seconds

recipeInstructions.text: If the dough is somewhat dry, add in more non-dairy milk, 1 teaspoon at a time until you can make a dough which is somewhat sticky and crumbly, not necessarily all together, but sticks when you press.
recipeInstructions.name: If the dough is somewhat dry, add in more non-dairy milk, 1 teaspoon at a time until you can make a dough which is somewhat sticky and crumbly, not necessarily all together, but sticks when you press.

recipeInstructions.text: Press this dough into a greased 9 inch tart pan (or use a pie pan) . Use a fork to create holes in the dough. Then bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 c) for 13 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Press this dough into a greased 9 inch tart pan (or use a pie pan) . Use a fork to create holes in the dough. Then bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 c) for 13 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile for the filling:  heat up oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for half a minute. Then add in the leeks, mushrooms, and salt and continue to cook until the mushrooms are golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile for the filling:  heat up oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for half a minute. Then add in the leeks, mushrooms, and salt and continue to cook until the mushrooms are golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the mushrooms are somewhat golden, add in the spinach. Mix in and continue until the spinach moisture is evaporated for 3-4 minutes. Cool this mixture for 10 mins
recipeInstructions.name: Once the mushrooms are somewhat golden, add in the spinach. Mix in and continue until the spinach moisture is evaporated for 3-4 minutes. Cool this mixture for 10 mins

recipeInstructions.text: Make the tofu egg mixture by adding all of the ingredients to a food processor with 2 tablespoons of water and processing it until the mixture is somewhat smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the tofu egg mixture by adding all of the ingredients to a food processor with 2 tablespoons of water and processing it until the mixture is somewhat smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix your mushroom leek filling in this mixture and then transfer it to the baked pie crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix your mushroom leek filling in this mixture and then transfer it to the baked pie crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Even it out. Top it with some cherry tomatoes or sun-dried tomatoes and bake for 30-35 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Even it out. Top it with some cherry tomatoes or sun-dried tomatoes and bake for 30-35 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the center is set and not jiggly, the quiche is done. Take it out of the oven and let it sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the center is set and not jiggly, the quiche is done. Take it out of the oven and let it sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
